newsitem.title: CANADA: Ontario to double Euro-note program to C$6 bln.
newsitem.headline: Ontario to double Euro-note program to C$6 bln.

text.p: Ontario's Conservative government said on Monday that it will double the size of its Euro-Medium Term Note Program to C$6 billion.
Ontario Finance Minister Ernie Eves said the C$3 billion increase was in response to recent market demand and investor interest expressed during a European trade mission led by Premier Mike Harris.
"This is another good indication of investors' renewed confidence in Ontario based on the province's declining deficit and strong economic growth," Eves said in a statement.
The Euro-Medium Term Note program was established in 1992 and has C$2.6 billion outstanding.
"In the last two months alone, C$400 million has been issued, making the doubling of the program size essential to meet growing investor demand," Eves said.
